header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends

body.u: right so we're ready yeah so this'll be fun for the academics I think I'll make a nice change for them we're going to do the oatcake test now so I've got two plates of oatcakes one is the Morrisons brand and one is the Nairn's brand and then is going to see if he can determine which is which now what do you think about the appearance?
erm well I think one is slightly darker than the other as in er the er type of oats used
er the one that is using a darker complexion also a erm has a darker edge
that's the other one erm is a lighter colour and a lighter edge in terms of roughness they're relatively similar and in terms of depth er the lighter one is just very slightly thinner
okay then right so what about the taste?
do you think it's quite crisp that one?
another the darker one has quite a a crunch
erm relatively floury in taste erm er getting oat tastes and relatively crunchy for an oatcake
right do you like that one?
erm er er it's not a bad oatcake
how many marks out of ten would you give it?
er you can see the layers which is
erm the I'd say it's er seven out of ten
now try the next one don't take a really huge bite
so how do you find that one?
that's not quite as floury as the other one
mm is that a good thing?
in a slightly positive way erm the layers are still relatively well defined
the it's like a little bit sweeter
do you prefer it a little bit sweeter?
yes so how many marks out of ten for that one?
er I think that's perhaps more of an eight and a half
mm so you think that one's a superior product?
so which one do you think is the Morrisons one and which one do you think is the Nairn's?
I think the darker one is the Morrisons one
and I think the lighter one is the Nairn's
alright so let's turn the plates over that's the Nairn's
Nairn's is the dark one and Morrisons
no so are you going to review your buying policy?
I am a little bit surprised er I'd say
do you think the labels are on the wrong dishes?
yes yeah well I must admit I'm the ones that I've seen of Nairn's in the past have they looked more like that
it could be just a dark batch do you think?
mm it could be a one-off
mm that's good interesting so did you recognise your regular brand?
when we were small me and my sister we used to go to my uncle and auntie's on a Boxing Day
my uncle used to do what was called the Smartie test

and we used to blindfold him and then we used to feed him Smarties and he reckoned that he could detect which was the orange Smartie because in those days all the Smarties had milk chocolate in the middle but the one that was orange had orange flavoured chocolate in
you know like a Terry's Chocolate Orange sort of taste
so we used to feed him the Smarties and he used to have to have a little sip of sherry in between each one just to cleanse the palate you know
well it was Christmas wasn't it? and er we used to think that was great fun so we didn't know how happy we were you don't get uncles like that any more do you?
no I don't think you've had an uncle like that have you?
we were quite lucky with uncles in those days

mm and we had another uncle not only like that he took us to the zoo and erm I had this packet of ginger biscuits and we were feeding them to the elephants and I never knew that elephants really like ginger biscuits
I don't think you'd get away with that nowadays
probably not it would say do not feed the animals
and what do you think er
was the big attraction for the elephants to have the ginger biscuit?
I don't know they'd probably got fed up of his normal I don't know what elephants normally eat
that's pandas isn't it? so probably a nice change to get something sweet
and erm I heard it said that the way to have a happy and fulfilled life apart from having uncles that do a Smartie test and let you feed ginger biscuits to elephants is to plant a tree
to have a son and to write a book so we how many trees have you planted?
I've planted five trees I've planted an apple tree a plum tree erm a pear tree er a cherry tree and er another apple so that's one dessert apple and one cooking apple
mm and have they brought you happiness?
er no I don't really in some ways it's er the performance with trees is erm very varied erm think one delight that is more or less guaranteed every year is that erm the trees blossom which er
they have very delicate and intricate flowers
but er in terms of fruits it's a bit less predictable
er perhaps so far as the saying you can't count chickens until the eggs have hatched
erm that er frosts and disease and pest attacks
once the er blossom has set so
I think once you get the blossom they are quite vulnerable aren't they?
and although they had a lot of blossom on all of the trees
the pear for instance I think
I think there's only about two pears
and I don't mean four I mean four I mean two
not bad on the plums had quite a lot of plums this year
and plum chutney and I've been able to put lots of plums in the freezer for crumbles and things
so I think they've been quite a joy don't you?
and picking the apples climbing up the ladder and getting all the best ones which are always at the top aren't they?
yes and the erm extender the like a net on a pole is quite a good buy
yeah that's been really invaluable hasn't it?
but I'm very tall so that helps
true I've also had quite a good harvest of brambles
yes it's been a bit of a surprise that has
I think the good thing about brambles is they're not hard to grow
they're more or less a weed I think
but they are expensive to buy
they are expensive they are very dear
yes so say compared to an apple or a
which maybe twenty or thirty pence each a punnet of blackberries could easily be two or three pounds
yeah and picked about two ice cream boxes of brambles this year haven't we?
I think we've done well and there's still some to pick aren't there cos some
some more to pick for next week
I'd say because it's on a a little bit of a slope
this should be well they'll be well drained
mm I think it's probably quite an old saying because I think it will be considered a bit unfair to say that just a son will make you happy and fulfilled I think any child really has potential

whether it's a boy or a girl but I think it's a bit like the Christmas carol it's all your hopes and all your fears when you have your baby and watch them grow up cos somehow it's more heightened the sensation for instance when you've been doing your exams I've been much more perplexed and really felt for you more so than when I did them myself I think you take it more in my stride I think

but er it seems more important when it's your own child I think and really it's your life's work watching your child grow up and it's all your effort trying to make it right and trying to make it erm better than it was for you and make you
more successful and that you erm get the benefit of what I've learnt
and my education so that you know the benefit trickles down the generations
yes I think perhaps books are a bit more of a a tricky aspect I suppose one thing is erm everyone well most people would have the ability to be able to write a book but it's
but it's it's quite another thing getting it published and
yes well we've got quite a few stories that we've written down haven't we?
but just because we haven't got them published it just means that they're going to be within the family aren't they? so
in some ways it sort of keeps it private doesn't it? and they're our special stories

that we'll still have to share won't we? you think what there is the common factor between all those things is that it's something that is going to live after you've gone it's like a little bit of a legacy
the trees'll be still there for some time

after we've all grown old and your children are there mostly unless there's an accident after you've gone and your work really what you've written could be I suppose these days people write blogs don't they?
erm I suppose in the old days you used to write a diary
and they were meant to be private they were often sold with a little key or a little padlock on
because they were private and secret and confidential but nowadays people seem to put the blogs on the internet
for everybody to share and everybody to read
I don't know there seems to be a difference in attitude doesn't there? about whether it's
private or whether it's something that you're going to share with anybody who cares to read your diary
I think there are a number of downsides to that is that people are posting things every twenty minutes or
every hour or something that when if you meet that person erm face-to-face you you don't actually have anything to discuss
new to say well you could talk about what they've already said
in the diary but there isn't any news is there?
no there isn't anything new to tell you cos you already know it all
and another thing is that things might be said that you wish you hadn't said
that you want to change and there's this controversy about whether you can hide things that have been put on the internet for instance
retract them but I don't know that it's possible is it?
well I think er the European Union er the court rulings have erm tried t made it possible for people to block er results from when you search their own name erm in the key search engines
right I believe that people who are looking to recruit or employ people for jobs can check Facebook accounts
and things see if there's any silly photographs or compromising
photographs and so on that they probably wish they hadn't put on
if they're applying for a serious job
I don't think it would really help you
no so at least one advantage of not having a Facebook account
yes I don't think it's something that really appeals to me I think if I want to tell a friend something or if I want to tell my family something then I'd rather meet them and tell them personally
or tell them over the telephone rather than just put it out there and then you have to er look on the Facebook account if you find out if I've got any news to tell you
yes but er some might say it's a way of keeping in contact with perhaps your extended family or friends
that you haven't met for a long time
yes or maybe some people are are more private than others
unless I suppose it's because it's a reflection of individual personalities
one thing that really I've not done er for I don't think we've ever done it is made marmalade with them whilst we've made chutney and we've made
I love your lemon curd you have to have that or it wouldn't be a real Christmas would it?
if you didn't have lemon curd tarts
mince pies but grandma makes it doesn't she?
but it think it's become something that is being consumed mainly by the older generation
but that's when we have the grandparents visiting
but we do eat it then don't we?
but we don't really have it
also erm I sometimes use it in my ginger parkin recipe
yes when we make that at Halloween time
with a spoonful of marmalade can help you make it nice and moist can't it?
yes are there any other er condiments or preserves that you would ever consider making?
erm well we've made two jams haven't we raspberry jam cos we went raspberry picking didn't we?
and the plum jam which we made as the kind of it's supposed to be Christmas in a jar jam plums er orange juice and orange rind spices like cinnamon and some port I think that was really nice
and it's very good for them cold winter mornings isn't it to have toast and that jam and the lemon curd I'm not really thinking of any more cos I don't think we could eat much more jam really
the next thing I'll be thinking about making is erm Christmas puddings
and then we're going to make the Christmas cakes maybe September October time
to give them plenty of time to mature ready for Christmas
and then keep feeding them with brandy putting the little holes in the bottom and
feeding them up so they're nice and moist
I think we've had quite a good success on that
and it's a little tradition that we've built up together isn't it?
mm the one thing we have yet to do is to erm get a a mixer that
meeting the er demanding requirements at this time of year
quite I think the food mixer we've got is really past its best isn't it?
it's on its last legs and
it's making a lot of noise and I think the
it's making a lot of noise and
er the motor clogs are not quite catching are they?
mm yeah no they're not and there's a bit of a strange rubbery smell when it er
it's been running for some time so
yeah so are you planning to get a another hand mixer or are you thinking about more like a a chef's mixer with a
a bit of a large bowl and spinning
yeah I would like that because I think it will be easier for me because I find it quite heavy now doing the mix there
especially if it's butter as opposed to margarine it's quite stiff to get it erm nice and soft so if you had a mixer with the stand I think that will be easier
but the downside is they are quite a lot more expensive
so we'd have to do a bit of research I think erm and see if we could find one at a good price maybe if
John Lewis have a sale or something
we could er get one there that would be suitable
yes but by the look of it a suitable replacement does need to be found within the next
true because we need to get these Christmas cakes started and
I don't know what we'll do
